description: The Democratic Party has proposed using virtual voting for its nomination process and setting a minimum delegate threshold to make the ballot — outlining the rules for a race that could quickly become moot as Vice President Kamala Harris clears the field.
title: Democrats Unveil Nomination Rules, Virtual Vote as Harris Surges

description: Low Taek Jho, the alleged mastermind of the looting of Malaysia’s 1MDB fund, was ordered to forfeit a trio of “flawless” diamonds he bought for his mother that were from the jeweler who’s designed for celebrities like Beyonce and Adele.
title: 1MDB Fugitive Low Must Forfeit Mom’s Trio of ‘Flawless’ Diamonds

description: It took just seconds for Lateefah Simon to signal her support for Kamala Harris as the Democratic party’s nominee to run for president.
title: A Six-Second Decision Shows How Harris Is Snapping Up Delegates

description: A group of Silicon Valley billionaires is pushing the pause button on their ambitious plans to build a new city northeast of San Francisco.
title: California’s Billionaire-Backed City Abandons Ballot Measure

description: Drinking a glass of wine over lunch, Zhou Xiaochuan, China’s central bank governor at the time, talked freely as he was peppered with questions from economists at Western banks.
title: Xi Cements Role as ‘Chief Economist,’ Shrinking Space for Debate

description: A US House committee called on the chief executive officer of CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. to testify on a defective software update that caused widespread global outages.
title: CrowdStrike’s CEO Called to Testify Before US House Committee

description: Mexico must ramp up investment in the semiconductor industry in the next two years in order to avoid losing ground to competitor countries, with guarantees needed that companies will have sufficient water and energy, said a top US aid official in Mexico.
title: Mexico Urged by US to Boost Chip Production Within Two Years

description: President Joe Biden’s top diplomatic and defense officials are proceeding as planned with a trip to Japan and the Philippines this week as part of a “full-steam ahead” approach to the rest of the world even after his decision to not seek a second term, officials said.
title: Biden Agenda ‘Full Steam Ahead’ With Officials Traveling to Asia

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove looks at some of Kamala Harris’s options for a running mate. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Harris’ Next Big Decision Is Picking a Running Mate

description: Republican Vice Presidential nominee JD Vance called President Joe Biden’s departure from the 2024 race a “threat to democracy,” using the same rhetoric he decried just days ago, following the assassination attempt against Donald Trump.
title: Vance Calls Democrats ‘Threat to Democracy’ After Biden Drops Out

description: The US will expand its military readiness and surveillance in the Arctic given heightened Chinese and Russian interest coupled with new risks brought on by accelerating climate change, the Pentagon said in a new report.
title: Pentagon to Bolster Response to China, Russia in Arctic

description: The group raised more than $1.5 million in just three hours
title: How 44,000 Black Women Galvanized Support for Kamala Harris on Sunday Night

description: President Joe Biden’s symptoms from Covid-19 have “almost resolved completely,” his doctor said, as the president remains isolated for the fifth day at his Delaware beach home.
title: Biden’s Covid Symptoms Have Nearly Resolved, White House Doctor Says

description: A sizable portion of World Trade Organization members supported a move from a group of African countries pushing for Director-General Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala to expedite a run for a second four-year term.
title: WTO Members Push to Expedite an Okonjo-Iweala Second Term Bid

description: A top US official said Dan Gertler’s royalties in the Democratic Republic of Congo must go to the country’s government as part of any deal that would ease sanctions on the billionaire mining magnate accused of corruption.
title: US Says Billionaire Gertler’s Royalties Must Go to Congo for Sanctions Deal

description: French President Emmanuel Macron called for a “political truce” during the summer Olympics in Paris, which begin Friday, potentially delaying the appointment of a prime minister and the formation of a new government.
title: Macron Calls for Political Truce, Says French Need Olympics Rest

description: Nancy Pelosi endorsed Kamala Harris for president, joining a Democratic groundswell for the vice president’s bid to fill a vacancy the former House speaker helped orchestrate.
title: Pelosi Endorses Harris for President After Pushing Biden to Exit

description: Rwandan President Paul Kagame secured a fourth term after winning 99.2% of the vote, extending his two-and-a-half-decade rule of the East African nation.
title: Rwanda Confirms Kagame’s Landslide Win With 99.2% of Vote

description: Kamala Harris is quickly winning supporters for her presidential bid within the top rungs of high finance — joining her “KHive” of online fans.
title: Wall Street’s ‘KHive’ Fired Up as McGuire, Lasry Back Harris

description: The European Union’s foreign policy chief said he plans on moving an August meeting of the bloc’s foreign and defense ministers from Budapest to Brussels to protest Viktor Orban’s diplomatic forays.
title: EU Moves Key Meeting Out of Hungary to Protest Orban’s Diplomacy

description: A knife-wielding Canadian citizen was shot dead by Israeli guards near the boundary with the Gaza Strip, the Israeli army and police said, in a rare incident that may have been linked to international protests against the war in the Palestinian territory.
title: Knife-Wielding Canadian Shot Dead Near Israel-Gaza Boundary

description: Vice President Kamala Harris quickly consolidated support from powerful Democrats for her nascent presidential bid, with an effort to end the turmoil that has consumed her party and alter an election that has become Donald Trump’s to lose.
title: Harris Cements Democratic Support as 2024 Election Is Reset

description: “Get paid to care for your loved ones,” the subway ad for one of New York’s Medicaid-funded home health aide programs says.
title: New York City’s Biggest Job Engine Has Become a ‘Racket,’ Hochul Says

description: A Russian court sentenced a dual Russian-US citizen and journalist for Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty to six-and-a-half years in a prison colony on the same day that Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich was convicted of espionage.
title: Russia Convicted Second US Journalist on Same Day as Gershkovich

description: New York state Democrats are lining up behind Vice President Kamala Harris as the party’s presidential nominee less than 24 hours after President Joe Biden withdrew from the race.
title: New York Democrats Led by Hochul Throw Support to Kamala Harris

description: The sudden elevation of Vice President Kamala Harris as the Democratic front-runner injects fresh uncertainty into the US election for world leaders already grappling with the implications of Donald Trump’s potential return to the presidency.
title: World Leaders Rush to Size Up Harris While Bracing for Trump Win

description: Slovakia’s defense minister is pushing for a major boost to ammunition production. Yet while his government steadfastly refuses to arm Ukraine, Slovak-made shells are ending up there.
title: Slovakia Is Arming Ukraine Even Though It Doesn’t Want To

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said he and Finance Minister Fernando Haddad still have to agree on a new central bank governor, as investors mull whether the change could alter the nation’s monetary policy.
title: Lula Says He Has Yet to Decide on a New Brazil Central Bank Governor

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva warned his long-term ally Nicolas Maduro that Venezuela’s economic future hinges on a clean election that ensures government legitimacy before the international community.
title: Lula Says Maduro Needs to Learn How to Lose an Election

description: Illinois governor J.B. Pritzker and Michigan’s Gretchen Whitmer endorsed Kamala Harris for the presidency, ending speculation that they might challenge the vice president for the nomination.
title: Pritzker, Whitmer Endorse Harris as Governors Fall in Line

description: Trans Mountain Corp. plans to borrow in the bond market to refinance some of its outstanding debt ahead of the Canadian government’s eventual sale of the oil pipeline operator, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trans Mountain Pipeline Weighs Debt Deal Ahead of Potential Sale

description: Wall Street has a sorry record trying to predict – and trade — pivotal elections at the best of times. Now as Joe Biden’s withdrawal upends the US presidential race, the danger of investing based on the latest political headlines has been thrown into sharp relief.
title: Biden Exit Sounds Alarm on Trump Trades Riven With Contradiction

description: The US and the Philippines’ foreign and defense secretaries will meet on July 30 in Manila as the allies look to strengthen ties amid tensions with China.
title: US, Philippines Foreign and Defense Chiefs to Meet on July 30

description: The embattled head of the Secret Service said she took full responsibility for security lapses around the assassination attempt of former President Donald Trump during a combative congressional hearing where some lawmakers called for her to resign.
title: Secret Service Head Says Agency Failed During Trump Rally

description: Kimberly Cheatle, director of the United States Secret Service, is sworn in during a House Oversight and Accountability Committee hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, July 22, 2024. The US Secret Service's embattled leader pledged cooperation with all investigations into the agency after the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump.
title: Secret Service Chief Cursed at by GOP Lawmaker at Hearing

description: Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear Monday said he would consider joining a presidential ticket led by Vice President Kamala Harris as attention turns to who could be her running mate if she secures the Democratic nomination.
title: Kentucky’s Beshear Says He Would Consider Vice President Spot

description: Four years ago, when Joe Biden picked Kamala Harris as his running mate, much of India was abuzz over how the first Indian-American in the White House might affect the future of US-India relations.
title: Harris Gets Muted Response in India as Few See Change in US Ties

description: The United Arab Emirates and Mauritius signed an economic agreement aimed at increasing bilateral trade, particularly in the financial, logistics and services sectors.
title: UAE Signs Economic Pact With Mauritius Aiming to Boost Trade

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government has turned to raising taxes on businesses to help fund Canada’s budget, adding headwinds to an economy that’s already struggling to attract investment.
title: Trudeau’s Tax Hikes Risk Worsening Canada’s Struggle for Capital

description: The US envoy to the United Nations arrived in Haiti on Monday as part of efforts to push for new elections, returning to the impoverished country for the first time in three years.
title: US Ambassador Arrives in Haiti to Discuss Aid, Democratic Push

description: Veteran climate negotiator Laurence Tubiana, who was put forward by France’s Socialist Party as a potential prime minister, withdrew her candidacy after the New Popular Front alliance of left-wing parties failed to unite behind her.
title: Socialists’ Pick for French Premier Tubiana Drops Out of Race

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said his new Labour government would improve skills training in the UK as a way of ending record levels of migration, a key issue during this month’s general election campaign.
title: Starmer Pitches UK Skills Upgrade to Reduce Record Migration

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will join finance ministers from Group of 20 nations in Rio de Janeiro this week for a series of meetings addressing urgent global issues, but the talks are likely to be overshadowed by US politics.
title: Yellen Heads to G-20 Meetings With Eye on China, Shadow of Trump

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Political Chaos in the US Echoes the Turbulent 1960s

description: Bulgaria’s political stalemate deepened further Monday, bringing the country closer to a seventh general election in less than four years, as an attempt to form a coalition with an anti-corruption agenda failed.
title: Bulgaria Moves Closer to New Election After Another Vote Fails

description: The Israeli military ordered civilians to leave parts of the Gazan city of Khan Younis due to a renewed assault against Hamas, even as it reduced the size of an already overcrowded humanitarian zone where they could potentially take shelter.
title: Israel Tells More Gaza Civilians to Move as Netanyahu Visits US

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said his country is seeking ways to ease tensions in contested areas but the nation won’t yield amid a dispute with Beijing on the South China Sea.
title: Marcos Says Philippines Favors Easing Sea Row, But Won’t Yield

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez has been summoned to testify as a witness in a criminal investigation into his wife’s business dealings.
title: Spanish PM Sanchez Summoned as Witness in Wife’s Criminal Case

description: Donald Trump, fresh off a convention where the Republican Party’s confidence in him was palpable, must now deal with a harsh reality: The 2024 race has gotten dramatically trickier to navigate with President Joe Biden’s decision to drop out.
title: Trump Risks Getting Tables Turned on Him With New 2024 Adversary

description: Ukraine is putting its own fuel supply at risk by barring the transit of a major Russian oil supplier to eastern Europe, Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico said.
title: Slovakia Warns Ukraine on Fuel After Kyiv Bars Lukoil Transit

description: How things could change under a Trump administration.
title: The US and China Are in an All Out Race for AI Domination

description: Security forces patrolled Bangladesh’s capital Dhaka on Monday, as a government-imposed curfew attempted to quell student-led protests against a public sector hiring system.
title: Uneasy Calm Across Bangladesh as Curfew Quells Jobs Protests

description: The Philippines’ National Security Council described as “fabricated and malicious hoax” a video circulating on social media linking President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to alleged use of illegal drugs.
title: Philippines Says Video Linking Marcos to Drug Use Is Fabricated

description: China officially avoided commenting on Kamala Harris’ late entry into the US presidential race. But state-backed news outlets and social-media users cast her as a weak vice president whose candidacy didn’t present a major threat to the world’s No. 2 economy.
title: China Focuses on Kamala Harris’s Weaknesses After Biden Exits

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa signed a law that will give savers early access to part of their retirement funds.
title: Ramaphosa Signs Law Allowing Savers Access to Retirement Funds

description: A Hong Kong court sentenced two defendants to six years and eight months of prison time for market manipulation, the longest ever punishment for such an offense in the financial hub, according to the presiding judge.
title: HK Court Hands Out Longest Jail Time for Market Manipulation

description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te urged the ruling party to better develop the public’s sense of belonging to the democratically run archipelago, comments that risk worsening his difficult relationship with China.
title: Taiwan’s President Risks Angering China With ‘National Identity’ Call

description: South Korean battery maker LG Energy Solution Ltd. is slowing construction of its third plant with General Motors Co. in Michigan amid lackluster demand for electric cars and as foreign firms worry about political change in the US.
title: LG Slows EV Cell Plant With GM in US as Political Worries Swirl

description: The death of Vietnam’s Communist Party chief Nguyen Phu Trong has left an opening for his former anti-corruption enforcer to take the nation’s most powerful job at a time the one-party state seeks to maximize gains from US-China competition.
title: Vietnam Party Chief’s Death Gives Anti-Graft Czar Way to Top Job

description: In India’s first budget under a new coalition government, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to stick to a plan of curbing the fiscal deficit, while still cutting taxes and boosting welfare spending to keep his allies happy.
title: What to Expect From India’s Budget, From Tax Cuts to Welfare Support

description: President Joe Biden is out of the 2024 race for the White House, but his team is signaling he’s not nearly done yet when it comes to foreign policy.
title: Biden Looks to Project Strength Abroad Despite Lame-Duck Status

description: Within hours of Joe Biden’s decision to bow out of the presidential race, many of the biggest names in Democratic politics — from Hillary Clinton to Gavin Newsom to megadonor George Soros — rushed to join him in backing Vice President Kamala Harris at the top of the ticket.
title: Soros Backs Harris as Other Wall Street Democrats Want a Contest

description: In one of the worst political calculations in American history, President Joe Biden bet an early debate with Donald Trump would boost his election odds. It backfired spectacularly, crystallizing concerns over his age and acuity and immediately throwing his final campaign into crisis.
title: Here Are The Key Moments From Biden’s Debate Debacle to Dropping Out

description: Senator Joe Manchin of West Virginia is considering rejoining the Democratic Party to vie for its presidential nomination after President Joe Biden announced he would drop out of the race, according to an adviser.
title: Manchin Weighs Presidential Run as Democrat After Biden Exits

description: Passing the baton to Kamala Harris is a $96 million bet that she can energize the campaign in the shortest presidential race in history.
title: Joe Biden Bows to Democrats Who Wanted Him Out, Upending US Politics

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s plans to boost the economy and uphold claims in South China Sea are expected to take center stage as he delivers his third State of the Nation Address in Congress on Monday.
title: Marcos to Address South China Sea, Taxes in Speech to Nation

description: China’s ruling Communist Party pledged to accelerate a new housing model that emphasizes renting and ramps up affordable homes, following a record property slump.
title: China Vows to Accelerate New Affordable-Housing Model

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is now the obvious heir as the Democratic nominee following President Joe Biden’s announcement that he would not seek reelection. Harris’s ascent is a remarkable turn of fate for a politician whose unpopularity has been viewed as a key reason why Biden initially decided to seek a second term. While Harris, 59, has secured major endorsements and has strong appeal with crucial voting blocs for Democrats — as the first woman of color to serve as vice president — there i
title: A Brief History of Kamala Harris and Her Politics

description: Vice President Kamala Harris became the clear favorite for her party’s nomination as possible rivals lined up to follow President Joe Biden’s lead and endorse her.
title: Who Might Kamala Harris Choose as Her Running Mate?
